sense.name: perceive by sight
sense.commentary: Note: This refers to input through the eyes.
sense.examples: Can you see the bird in that tree? His fumbling the ball was seen on TV by millions of viewers. The camera saw the burglary and recorded it. I must see your passport before you can enter the country. Don't drive after taking the medication. It will make you see double.

sense.name: realize, visualize or understand mentally (or through imagination)
sense.examples: I just can't see your point. They saw a risk in his strategy. I am not seeing this situation as hopeless. I see what you mean.

sense.name: witness, observe, or experience
sense.commentary: Note: -This implies more than just a momentary visual input. It implies an experience. -This sense includes the use of artistic sight
sense.examples: Did you see any encouragement from him? You'll see a lot of cheating in this school. He saw action in Vietnam. I see that you have been promoted. I saw Berlin before the Wall came down. They are planning to see two museums tomorrow. 1960 saw the rebellion of the younger generation against established traditions. As an artist, you must learn to see.

sense.name: verify, prove, check or insure by actively examining (evidence)
sense.examples: He's going to see whether the train will leave on time. See whether you can come tomorrow. He went to see if the valves were indeed closed.

sense.name: take care of, take responsilibity over, keep up with
sense.examples: Can you see about this matter at once? Jeff's job is to see to it that the visitors get the proper reception. Jeeves will see you to the door. The sponsor has promised us to see the project to completion. See to it!

sense.name: meet or encounter on social or professional capacity
sense.examples: How nice to see you again! He's been seeing a therapist for two years. She hasn't seen her mother in six months. The doctor will see you now. His wife thinks he's seeing another woman.

sense.name: match as in poker game
sense.examples: I'll see you and raise you ten.

sense.name: SEE RED-become angry or upset
sense.examples: When I saw that man hit my mother, I saw red.

sense.name: SEE THE LIGHT-change or reform for the bettter
sense.examples: The lazy student finally saw the light.

sense.name: SEE EYE TO EYE-be in agreement
sense.examples: We never saw eye to eye on this question.

sense.name: Deliberate or decide.
sense.examples: See if you can get in touch with the agent. Let's see.
